question:
The Ebony, Mahogany, Cinchona etc. are trees found in which type of forests in India?

SSC MTS 17/10/2024 (1st Shift)
solution:
• Ebony, Mahogany, and Cinchona are valuable hardwood trees found in Tropical Evergreen Forests.
  • These forests are located in high rainfall regions (more than 200 cm annually) and remain green throughout the year due to dense canopy cover.
  • Found mainly in the Western Ghats, Andaman & Nicobar Islands, and parts of the North-Eastern states, these forests are known for their rich biodiversity.
  • The dense foliage does not allow much sunlight to reach the forest floor, creating a humid and dark environment ideal for these species.

Additional Information:

  • Tropical Deciduous Forests (also called monsoon forests) shed leaves in dry season and contain species like sal, teak.
  • Thorny Forests are found in arid regions and have plants like cactus, acacia.
  • Mangrove Forests grow in coastal, saline water regions (e.g., Sundarbans).

question:
Magnolia and Laurel trees are found in which type of forest in India?

SSC MTS 29/10/2024 (1st Shift)
solution:
• Magnolia and Laurel trees are typically found in Montane Forests, which occur in the mountainous regions of India.
  • These forests exist at higher elevations, usually above 1000 meters, where temperature and humidity conditions support the growth of moist, dense vegetation.
  • Montane forests can be further classified into subtropical and temperate types, depending on the altitude.
  • These forests are common in Himalayan regions, Western Ghats, and parts of North-East India.

Additional Information:

  • Tropical Thorn Forests are found in arid regions with low rainfall and contain dry shrubs, acacia, and cactus.
  • Mangrove Forests grow in coastal tidal zones (like the Sundarbans).
  • Tropical Deciduous Forests shed leaves seasonally and are found in regions with moderate rainfall.

question:
________ leaves are used to make bidis.

SSC CGL12/09/2024 (2nd Shift)
solution:
• Tendu leaves are widely used in India for making bidis, which are traditional hand-rolled cigarettes.
  • The leaves are collected, dried, and used as wrappers to roll tobacco, forming bidis.
  • Tendu (Diospyros melanoxylon) is a deciduous tree found in central and eastern India, especially in Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Odisha, and Maharashtra.
  • The collection and trade of tendu leaves is a significant source of livelihood for many tribal communities.

Additional Information:

  • Neem leaves are medicinal and not used for bidis.
  • Champa leaves are ornamental and aromatic.
  • Betel leaves are used for chewing with areca nut (paan), not for bidis.

question:
Sundari trees are found in which type of forests in India?

SSC CGL13/09/2024 (1st Shift)
option_3: The thorn forests and scrubs
solution:
• Sundari trees (Heritiera fomes) are characteristic of mangrove forests, especially found in the Sundarbans delta region of West Bengal and Bangladesh.
  • These trees are adapted to saline, swampy environments and are a dominant species in tidal, coastal regions.
  • Mangrove forests grow in intertidal zones along estuaries, creeks, and deltas where saltwater and freshwater mix.
  • The name "Sundarbans" is derived from the abundance of Sundari trees in the area.

Additional Information:

  • Tropical deciduous forests have species like teak and sal.
  • Thorn forests are found in dry, arid regions with plants like acacia and cactus.
  • Tropical evergreen forests are dense, found in high rainfall areas, and have trees like ebony and mahogany.

question:
Which of the following states has mangrove forests?

SSC CHSL 05/07/2024 (1st shift)
solution:
• Mangrove forests are coastal forests that grow in tropical and subtropical tidal regions, especially where freshwater and saltwater meet.
  • Andhra Pradesh, with a long eastern coastline along the Bay of Bengal, is home to several mangrove forest regions, especially in the Godavari and Krishna delta areas.
  • These mangroves are important for coastal protection, biodiversity, and as nurseries for marine life.

Other Options:

  • Telangana is a landlocked state — it has no coastal area, so it cannot have mangroves.
  • Rajasthan is also landlocked and arid, unsuitable for mangrove growth.
  • Manipur is in a hilly region of the Northeast and does not have the coastal environment needed for mangroves.

question:
In which of the following regions is the tropical evergreen forests found in India?

SSC CPO 27/06/2024 (2nd shift)
solution:
• Tropical evergreen forests are dense, multilayered forests that grow in regions with high annual rainfall (above 200 cm) and warm temperatures year-round.
  • In India, these forests are primarily found in the Western Ghats, parts of Northeast India, and the Andaman & Nicobar Islands.
  • The Western Ghats, which stretch along the western coast of India (Maharashtra, Goa, Karnataka, Kerala, and Tamil Nadu), receive heavy monsoonal rainfall and are ideal for tropical evergreen vegetation.
  • These forests are evergreen because the trees do not shed all their leaves at once, keeping the forest green throughout the year.

Other Options:

  • Eastern Ghats receive less rainfall and mostly support tropical deciduous forests.
  • The Rann of Kutch and Thar Desert are arid regions with thorn forests and scrub vegetation, not evergreen forests.

question:
In which of the following parts of India are thorn forests and scrub forests found?

SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (3rd shift)
solution:
• Thorn forests and scrub forests are found in dry and arid regions that receive low annual rainfall (less than 70 cm).
  • These forests consist of thorny trees, shrubs, and bushes like acacia, babool, cactus, and are adapted to conserve water.
  • In India, such vegetation is typically found in the north-western region, particularly in Rajasthan, Gujarat, parts of Punjab and Haryana — all of which are semi-arid to arid zones.
  • These forests are important for preventing soil erosion in desert-prone areas.

Other Options:

  • South-eastern and south-western India receive moderate to high rainfall and support deciduous or evergreen forests.
  • North-eastern India is a high-rainfall region and home to dense tropical rainforests, not thorn forests.

question:
Which of the following statements is NOT true about the moist deciduous forests of India?

SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Evening)
option_1: They grow in regions with rainfall of 100-200 cm.
option_2: They are found in the foothills of Himalayas.
option_3: They are found in the plains of Bihar and Uttar Pradesh.
option_4: Sal, amla, shisham and mahua are some of the main species of these forests.
solution:
• Moist deciduous forests grow in regions that receive moderate to high rainfall — typically between 100–200 cm annually. ✅
  • These forests are found in areas like the foothills of the Himalayas, eastern slopes of the Western Ghats, and parts of Odisha, Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand, etc. ✅
  • Sal, shisham, amla, and mahua are typical tree species found in these forests. ✅
  • However, in the plains of Bihar and Uttar Pradesh, the climate and rainfall patterns mostly support dry deciduous forests, not moist deciduous forests. ❌

Correct Answer:(c) They are found in the plains of Bihar and Uttar Pradesh.

Additional Information:

  • In moist deciduous forests, trees shed their leaves for a short period in the dry season to conserve water.
  • These forests have rich biodiversity and are economically important for timber and medicinal plants.

question:
In the Himalayas, the ________ temperature with increasing altitude causes the change in vegetation.

SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Evening)
solution:
• In the Himalayas, as one goes to higher altitudes, the temperature decreases gradually.
  • This decrease in temperature leads to distinct changes in vegetation zones — from tropical at the base, to temperate, and finally to alpine vegetation at higher elevations.
  • This phenomenon is an example of altitudinal zonation, where climate and vegetation types vary with elevation.

Correct Answer:(b) decreasing

Additional Information:

  • Tropical forests are found at the lower altitudes.
  • Temperate forests occur at mid-altitudes.
  • Alpine meadows and shrubs are found above the tree line.
  • Eventually, at very high altitudes, snow and ice dominate with no vegetation.

question:
Under which strata do trees fall ?

SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Afternoon)
solution:
• In a forest ecosystem, vegetation is structured in vertical layers or strata.
  • Trees, being the tallest and most dominant plants, fall under the top vertical stratum.
  • This top layer forms the canopy, which receives the maximum sunlight and controls much of the forest's microclimate.
  • Beneath the canopy are shrubs, herbs, and ground vegetation, forming the middle and lower strata.

Correct Answer:(b) Top vertical

Additional Information:

  • Top vertical stratum: Tall trees forming the canopy.
  • Middle vertical stratum: Shorter trees and shrubs.
  • Bottom vertical stratum: Herbs, grasses, and ground-level plants.
  • This layered structure helps different species coexist by utilizing sunlight and space differently.

question:
The natural vegetation of India is broadly divided into ______ groups.

SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Evening)
solution:
• The natural vegetation of India is broadly classified into five major groups based on factors such as climate, soil, and topography.
  • These five vegetation types represent the diverse ecological zones found across the country.
  • The five broad categories are:
    1. Tropical Evergreen Forests – Found in high rainfall areas like Western Ghats and Northeast India.
    2. Tropical Deciduous Forests – Most widespread; found in central and northern India.
    3. Thorn Forests and Scrubs – Found in arid regions like Rajasthan and Gujarat.
    4. Montane Forests – Located in the Himalayan and other mountainous regions.
    5. Mangrove Forests – Found in coastal tidal areas like the Sundarbans.

Additional Information:

  • These categories are further divided into sub-types depending on altitude, rainfall, and soil type.
  • India’s rich biodiversity is supported by this wide range of vegetation, from alpine meadows to coastal mangroves.

question:
In which type of forests are wild donkeys and camels found in India?

SSC MTS 14/09/2023 (3rd Shift)
option_3: Thorny forests and bushes
solution:
• Wild donkeys (Indian wild ass) and camels are animals that are well adapted to hot and arid environments.
  • These animals are found in desert and semi-desert regions like the Rann of Kutch (Gujarat) and Rajasthan, where the vegetation is sparse and consists mostly of thorny bushes, acacia, and cactus.
  • Such regions are covered by thorny forests and scrub vegetation, which are capable of surviving in low rainfall and high temperature zones.

Other Options:

  • Tropical evergreen forests are dense, humid, and unsuitable for desert animals.
  • Mountain forests are found in colder, high-altitude regions and host animals like snow leopards and Himalayan goats.
  • Mangrove forests grow in coastal, saline swampy areas — home to species like crocodiles, not desert animals.

question:
Sal, acacia and bamboo, which are types of Dry Tropical Forest, receive what amount of annual rainfall?

SSC CHSL 02/08/2023 (2nd shift)
solution:
• Dry Tropical Forests, also known as Tropical Dry Deciduous Forests, grow in regions where the annual rainfall ranges from 51 cm to 151 cm.
  • These forests are less dense compared to moist deciduous or evergreen forests and have trees that shed their leaves during the dry season to conserve water.
  • Sal, acacia, and bamboo are commonly found species in these forests, especially in states like Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra, and Odisha.
  • The trees in such forests are moderate in height and the forest floor is relatively open.

Other Options:

  • 200–250 cm and 251 cm or more correspond to moist deciduous and evergreen forests, respectively.
  • Below 25 cm is typical of desert or thorn forests, not suitable for sal or bamboo.

question:
Which of the following forest types is found on the foothills of the Himalayas?

SSC CHSL 09/08/2023 (1st shift)
solution:
• The foothills of the Himalayas, especially in the Shivalik ranges, experience moderate to high rainfall (100–200 cm) and have a seasonal climate.
  • These conditions support deciduous forests, particularly the moist deciduous type, where trees shed their leaves in the dry season to conserve water.
  • Common trees in this region include Sal, Teak, Bamboo, Amla, and Shisham.
  • These forests act as transition zones between tropical plains and montane forests.

Additional Information:

  • Temperate forests grow at higher altitudes, above the deciduous zone.
  • Alpine forests are found near the tree line, above the temperate belt.
  • Tundra vegetation consists of mosses and lichens and occurs in extremely cold, high-altitude areas, not in foothills.
  • The deciduous forests in the foothills are crucial for soil retention, biodiversity, and timber production.

question:
Which of the following is the most widespread forest type in India?

SSC CHSL 17/08/2023 (1st shift)
option_1: Littoral and Swamp Forest
solution:
• The Tropical Deciduous Forests are the most widespread forest type in India, covering the largest area among all forest categories.
  • These forests grow in regions with moderate rainfall (75–200 cm annually) and are found in interior parts of the country where seasonal climate dominates.
  • Trees in these forests shed their leaves in the dry season to conserve moisture.
  • They are commonly found in Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand, Odisha, Maharashtra, and parts of Uttar Pradesh and Bihar.

Additional Information:

  • Tropical deciduous forests are classified into:
    1. Moist Deciduous Forests – found in areas with 100–200 cm rainfall.
    2. Dry Deciduous Forests – found in areas with 75–100 cm rainfall.
  • These forests are economically significant for timber, fuelwood, and medicinal plants.
  • Common species: Sal, Teak, Shisham, Amla, Bamboo, and Mahua.

question:
What type of vegetation is found in the plateau of Meghalaya, Sahyadri and the central and southern islands of the Nicobar group?

SSC CGL20/07/2023 (3rd shift)
option_1: Dry Tropical Deciduous Vegetation
option_2: Dry Tropical Thorny Vegetation
option_4: Moist Tropical Semi- Evergreen Vegetation
solution:
• The Meghalaya plateau, Sahyadri hills (Western Ghats), and the central and southern Nicobar Islands receive high to very high rainfall and have a warm, humid climate.
  • These conditions support Moist Tropical Semi-Evergreen Vegetation, which is a transitional type between tropical evergreen and moist deciduous forests.
  • This forest type contains both evergreen trees and deciduous species, making it dense and multi-layered, though slightly less dense than evergreen forests.

Additional Information:

  • Common tree species in these forests include Cinnamon, Jackfruit, Terminalia, and Jamun.
  • These forests are rich in biodiversity, home to rare flora and fauna, and are important for timber and ecological balance.
  • Dry tropical vegetation types are found in areas with low rainfall, not in these high rainfall zones.
  • Alpine vegetation occurs only at very high altitudes, such as in the Himalayas, not in tropical islands or hills.

question:
Plant varieties like bamboo, epiphytes, aini, semul, gutel and mundane are found in which type of Indian forest?

SSC CGL24/07/2023 (2nd shift)
solution:
• Bamboo, aini (Artocarpus hirsutus), semul (Bombax ceiba), gutel (Trema orientalis), and mundane are characteristic of moist tropical forests.
  • These forests receive high annual rainfall (above 200 cm) and maintain high humidity, making them ideal for such species.
  • Epiphytes, which grow on other plants, are common in humid forest canopies, especially in tropical moist forests.
  • These forests are found in regions like the Western Ghats, Northeastern India, and parts of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands.
  • They support dense, evergreen vegetation and high biodiversity due to rich soil moisture.

Additional Information:

  • Dry tropical forests have less dense vegetation and feature drought-resistant trees like acacia.
  • Montane forests are found at higher altitudes and contain temperate species like oak and rhododendron.
  • Alpine forests occur above the tree line and are dominated by shrubs and hardy grasses.

question:
Which of the following states is associated with the tropical thorn forests?

Graduate Level 30/06/2023 (Shift- 1)
option_1: Andaman and Nicobar Islands
solution:
• Tropical thorn forests are found in dry and semi-arid regions of India where rainfall is less than 70 cm annually.
  • These forests are dominated by thorny shrubs, scattered trees, and drought-resistant species like acacia, euphorbia, and cactus.
  • Madhya Pradesh, particularly its western and northern regions, has areas with dry climate, making it suitable for tropical thorn vegetation.
  • These forests are adapted to high temperature, low humidity, and poor soil fertility.
  • They help in preventing soil erosion and are found in Rajasthan, Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh, and parts of Madhya Pradesh.

Additional Information:

  • Andaman and Nicobar Islands have tropical rainforests, not thorn forests.
  • West Bengal primarily has mangroves and moist deciduous forests.
  • Mizoram is a part of the northeastern rainforest zone, rich in evergreen and semi-evergreen forests.

question:
Mosses and lichens are found in which kind of forest?

SSC MTS 03/05/2023 (Morning)
solution:
• Mosses and lichens are characteristic vegetation of the Tundra forest biome, where harsh, cold climatic conditions prevail.
  • The Tundra region has frozen subsoil (permafrost) and experiences short summers and long, severe winters.
  • Due to low temperatures, tall trees cannot survive, and only low-growing plants like mosses, lichens, and small shrubs thrive.
  • These forests are found in polar regions like parts of Siberia, Northern Canada, and Alaska.
  • Mosses and lichens are specially adapted to cold, nutrient-poor, and dry conditions.

Additional Information:

  • Tropical rainforests support tall evergreen trees, not tundra species.
  • Temperate forests have deciduous trees like oak and maple.
  • Coniferous forests contain cone-bearing trees like pine and spruce, but not tundra vegetation.

question:
Major plantations are found in the

__________ region of the world.

SSC MTS 10/05/2023 (Morning)
solution:
• Major plantations of crops like tea, coffee, rubber, sugarcane, cotton, and oil palm are found in the tropical region of the world.
  • The tropical zone lies roughly between the Tropic of Cancer and Tropic of Capricorn and provides ideal climatic conditions such as:
    • High temperature
    • Abundant rainfall
    • Long growing seasons
  • Countries in tropical regions like India, Brazil, Indonesia, Vietnam, and Sri Lanka have extensive plantation agriculture.
  • This type of farming is typically commercial, labour-intensive, and focused on export-oriented crops.

Additional Information:

  • Grasslands are used mainly for grazing and cereal farming, not plantations.
  • Temperate zones grow wheat, barley, apples, etc., not tropical plantation crops.
  • Deserts are too dry for plantation agriculture due to lack of water.

question:
Which of the following is an example of a terrestrial ecosystem?

SSC MTS 20/06/2023 (Evening)
solution:
• A terrestrial ecosystem refers to an ecosystem found on land, as opposed to water.
  • Grasslands are a classic example of terrestrial ecosystems, comprising land-based habitats dominated by grasses and herbivores.
  • They support various species of plants, insects, herbivores, and carnivores and are crucial for carbon storage and grazing.
  • Other examples of terrestrial ecosystems include forests, deserts, and mountains.

Additional Information:

  • Ponds and rivers are examples of freshwater aquatic ecosystems.
  • Oceans fall under marine ecosystems.
  • Hence, the only land-based (terrestrial) ecosystem among the options is grasslands.

question:
In the higher latitudes (50°- 70°) of Northern hemisphere the spectacular Coniferous forests are found. These are also called as ______ .

SSC CHSL 09/03/2023 (3rd Shift)
solution:
• The coniferous forests found in the higher latitudes (50°–70° N) of the Northern Hemisphere are known as Taiga.
  • These forests are dominated by cone-bearing evergreen trees such as pine, spruce, fir, and larch.
  • Taiga is the largest terrestrial biome and spans countries like Canada, Russia, Norway, and Sweden.
  • It experiences long, cold winters and short, mild summers, making it suitable for cold-resistant vegetation.
  • The name “Taiga” originates from Russian and refers to the snow forests of the sub-Arctic region.

Additional Information:

  • Veld refers to grasslands in South Africa.
  • Tundra lies north of the Taiga, characterized by permafrost and no trees.
  • Llanos are tropical grasslands found in Venezuela and Colombia.

question:
In India, trees of which forest type shed their leaves for about six to eight weeks in dry summer?

SSC CHSL 10/03/2023 (4th Shift)
option_4: Tropical Thorn Forests and Scrubs
solution:
• In India, Tropical Deciduous Forests are also known as monsoon forests because they shed their leaves during the dry summer to conserve water.
  • These trees typically shed leaves for about 6 to 8 weeks when water becomes scarce, especially from March to May.
  • These forests are found in regions with moderate rainfall (100–200 cm annually), such as parts of Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Odisha, Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh, and Bihar.
  • Common tree species include sal, teak, peepal, neem, and banyan.

Additional Information:

  • Tropical Evergreen Forests do not shed all leaves together; they remain green year-round.
  • Montane Forests are found in mountainous regions and vary with altitude.
  • Tropical Thorn Forests are found in arid regions and have thorny bushes instead of large leaf-shedding trees.

question:
In India, what is the mean annual average temperature in subtropical vegetation zone ?

SSC CHSL 13/03/2023 (1st Shift)
solution:
• The subtropical vegetation zone in India lies mostly in the northern plains, central India, and the lower foothills of the Himalayas.
  • This zone experiences distinct seasonal variation — hot summers, cold winters, and moderate rainfall.
  • The mean annual average temperature in this zone generally ranges from 17°C to 24°C.
  • It supports vegetation like deciduous forests, grasslands, and some scrublands.
  • This range is ideal for crops like wheat, rice, and sugarcane as well as trees like sal and teak.

Additional Information:

  • Above 24°C is typical of tropical zones, such as coastal and southern India.
  • Below 7°C or 7°C to 17°C is found in temperate or alpine zones, especially in higher altitudes like the Himalayas.

question:
Which of the following pairs of countries- name of grassland is correct?

I. Argentina- Pampas

II. Brazil- Steppe

SSC CHSL 14/03/2023 (1st Shift)
option_1: Neither I nor II
option_4: Both I and II
solution:
• Statement I: Argentina – Pampas → ✅Correct
    • The Pampas are vast temperate grasslands located primarily in Argentina, and also extend into Uruguay and southern Brazil.
    • They are known for fertile soil, extensive cattle grazing, and wheat farming.
    • These grasslands are one of the most economically productive regions of South America.
  • Statement II: Brazil – Steppe → ❌Incorrect
    • Steppe refers to temperate grasslands typically found in Central Asia, Eastern Europe, and North America (as prairies).
    • Brazil has grassland regions like Campos and Cerrado, not steppes.

Additional Information:

  • Cerrado in Brazil is a tropical savanna, not a steppe.
  • Other famous grasslands:
    • Prairies – USA and Canada
    • Veld – South Africa
    • Downs – Australia
    • Steppe – Central Asia and parts of Eastern Europe

question:
The wet temperate type of forests are found between a height of _______ metres.

SSC CHSL 17/03/2023 (1st Shift)
solution:
• Wet temperate forests are typically found on the lower slopes of the Himalayas and in hilly regions with high rainfall.
  • These forests occur between 1000 and 2000 metres altitude, where the climate is cool and moist.
  • They support tree species like oak, chestnut, maple, and rhododendron.
  • The region receives high rainfall (often due to orographic precipitation) and maintains moderate temperatures throughout the year.
  • These forests have dense foliage, high humidity, and are often covered with mosses, ferns, and lichens.

Additional Information:

  • 500 to 1000 metres: Mostly subtropical or tropical deciduous forests.
  • 2000 to 3000 metres: Montane temperate or mixed coniferous forests.
  • Above 3000 metres: Alpine vegetation and meadows with very sparse tree cover.

question:
Thorny bushes are found in _____ region.

SSC CGL01/12/2022 (2nd Shift)
solution:
• Thorny bushes are typical of dry desert regions, where the climate is arid or semi-arid and rainfall is very low (usually less than 25 cm annually).
  • These plants have adaptations such as:
    • Thorns instead of leaves to reduce water loss
    • Thick stems for water storage
    • Deep or widespread roots to absorb maximum water
  • Common desert vegetation includes cactus, acacia, and euphorbia.
  • Such vegetation is found in Thar Desert (India), Sahara (Africa), and Atacama (South America).

Additional Information:

  • Mediterranean regions have scrub forests and olive trees, not thorny bushes.
  • Polar regions are too cold for such vegetation; they mostly have mosses and lichens.
  • High rainfall regions support evergreen or deciduous forests, not thorny vegetation.

question:
The type of forests located in mid latitudinal coastal region is__________

SSC CGL02/12/2022 (2nd Shift)
solution:
• Temperate evergreen forests are typically found in the mid-latitudinal coastal regions where the climate is mild and moist throughout the year.
  • These forests consist of broadleaf evergreen trees and sometimes conifers, depending on local climate.
  • Common locations include the southeastern USA, southern China, southeastern Brazil, eastern Australia, and coastal regions of Japan.
  • These forests remain green year-round and are adapted to humid coastal environments.

Additional Information:

  • Tropical rainforests are found near the equator, not in mid-latitudes.
  • Mediterranean vegetation is typical of dry summers and wet winters – found around the Mediterranean Sea, California, and parts of Chile.
  • Monsoon forests (tropical deciduous) occur in South and Southeast Asia and have distinct wet and dry seasons.

question:
The birds like pheasant and monals are found in which type of forest?

SSC CGL05/12/2022 (2nd Shift)
solution:
• Birds like pheasants and monals are typically found in temperate deciduous forests, which are located in moderate altitude zones with seasonal climate.
  • These forests are found in the lower Himalayas, parts of Jammu & Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh, and Uttarakhand.
  • Temperate deciduous forests are characterized by broad-leaved trees like oak, maple, and walnut, which shed leaves seasonally.
  • These forests provide a suitable habitat for colorful and shy birds like the Himalayan monal (state bird of Uttarakhand) and pheasants, due to their dense canopy and understory vegetation.

Additional Information:

  • Tropical evergreen forests are dense and humid, mostly home to reptiles and insects; monals are not found here.
  • Temperate evergreen forests contain conifers and are located at higher altitudes, less suited for monals and pheasants.
  • Mediterranean forests are dry and have sparser vegetation, unsuitable for these birds.

question:
A species of grass named ______ is on the verge of extinction due to its insensitivity towards the environment.

SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Morning)
solution:
• Hubbardia heptaneuron is a rare and endangered species of grass found in parts of the Western Ghats in India.
  • It is on the verge of extinction mainly due to its narrow habitat range and lack of adaptability to environmental changes.
  • This species shows low ecological plasticity, meaning it does not respond well to changes in its surrounding conditions such as deforestation, habitat fragmentation, and climate variation.
  • Conservation efforts are critical to protect such endemic and vulnerable grass species.

Additional Information:

  • Helianthus annuus – Scientific name of sunflower, widely cultivated and not endangered.
  • Saccharum officinarum – Scientific name of sugarcane, a major commercial crop.
  • Bellis perennis – Scientific name of common daisy, found in temperate zones and not at risk.

question:
The National Commission on Agriculture (1976) of India has classified social forestry into how many categories?

SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Afternoon)
solution:
• The National Commission on Agriculture (1976) introduced the concept of Social Forestry in India to involve the public in afforestation and conservation efforts.
  • It classified social forestry into 3 main categories to serve different environmental and social objectives:
    1. Farm Forestry – Planting trees on farmlands by individuals or farmers.
    2. Community Forestry – Raising trees on community land to benefit local populations.
    3. Extension Forestry – Plantation of trees along roadsides, canals, railway lines, etc., on public or unused land.
  • The focus was on meeting fuelwood, fodder, and small timber needs of the rural population while improving ecological balance.

Additional Information:

  • Social forestry aims to reduce pressure on natural forests, generate rural employment, and restore green cover.
  • Later, strip forestry was considered a sub-type under extension forestry.

question:
Which biome is found in the northern parts of Asia, Europe and North America where 300 to 900 millimeters (12 to 35 in) of rain can be expected per year?

Graduate Level 02/08/2022 (Shift- 3)
solution:
• The Coniferous forest biome is found in the northern parts of Asia, Europe, and North America, where annual precipitation ranges from 300 to 900 mm (12 to 35 inches).
  • These forests are dominated by cone-bearing trees such as pine, spruce, fir, and larch, which are adapted to cold climates and poor soils.
  • Coniferous forests include both Taiga (boreal forests) and temperate coniferous forests, depending on latitude and climate.
  • They have long, cold winters and short, cool summers, and are important for timber and carbon storage.

Additional Information:

  • Taiga forests are a subtype of coniferous forests found further north and have even harsher climates.
  • Temperate deciduous forests receive more rainfall (750–1500 mm) and have broad-leaved trees that shed annually.
  • Mediterranean forests occur in dry, warm regions with winter rainfall — unlike the cold northern biomes.

question:
The climatic conditions of thorn forests and scrubs are the most ideal for which of the following plant species?

SSC MTS 05/07/2022 (Evening)
solution:
• Thorn forests and scrubs are found in arid and semi-arid regions where the annual rainfall is less than 70 cm, and temperatures remain high with low humidity.
  • In such dry conditions, plants must conserve water, and hence, species with xerophytic adaptations (drought-resistant) thrive.
  • Euphorbia is a typical xerophytic plant commonly found in these regions. It:
    • Has thick, fleshy stems for water storage
    • Often has spines instead of leaves to reduce transpiration
    • Can survive in poor, dry soils

Additional Information:

  • Rosewood grows in moist deciduous forests with high rainfall.
  • Teak is found in tropical deciduous forests, which get moderate to high rainfall.
  • Juniper is suited for cold and dry temperate regions, such as high-altitude coniferous forests.

question:
Temperate grasslands are ideal for _______ cultivation.

SSC MTS 11/07/2022 (Morning)
solution:
• Temperate grasslands are found in regions with moderate rainfall, cold winters, and hot summers, making them ideal for wheat cultivation.
  • The soil in these regions, often called chernozem or black earth, is rich in organic matter and nutrients, which supports grain farming, especially wheat.
  • Examples of temperate grasslands:
    • Pampas – Argentina
    • Prairies – USA & Canada
    • Steppes – Central Asia
    • Downs – Australia
    • Velds – South Africa

Additional Information:

  • Grapes need warm, Mediterranean-type climates.
  • Apples grow best in cool temperate zones with chill hours, like Himalayan regions.
  • Cotton requires a warm climate with moderate rainfall — found in tropical/subtropical regions, not temperate grasslands.

question:
Which of the following is a temperate grassland in Russia?

SSC MTS 21/07/2022 (Afternoon)
solution:
• The Steppes are temperate grasslands found in Russia and Central Asia.
  • These regions have a continental climate with hot summers, cold winters, and moderate rainfall, ideal for grain cultivation, especially wheat.
  • The Steppes are vast treeless plains, covered mainly with grasses and herbs, and are an important agricultural zone of Russia.
  • They are comparable to:
    • Prairies (North America)
    • Pampas (Argentina)
    • Velds (South Africa)
    • Downs (Australia)

Additional Information:

  • Amazon – A dense tropical rainforest in South America.
  • Prairies – Temperate grasslands of USA and Canada.
  • Congo – Tropical rainforest region in central Africa, not a grassland.

question:
What type of forests are found north and south of the equator between 40° and 60° where rainfall is high, between 500-1500 mm in a year?

SSC CHSL 25/05/2022(Afternoon)
solution:
• Temperate deciduous forests are found north and south of the equator between 40° and 60° latitudes, mainly in eastern North America, Europe, East Asia, and parts of New Zealand and South America.
  • These forests occur in areas where annual rainfall ranges between 500 to 1500 mm, and the climate shows four distinct seasons.
  • Trees in these forests shed their leaves annually in autumn to conserve water during winter.
  • Common trees include oak, maple, beech, elm, and birch. These forests support rich flora and fauna due to moderate temperature and adequate rainfall.

Additional Information:

  • Taiga forests (also called boreal forests) are located further north (50°–70° N), with cold temperatures and conifers.
  • Coniferous forests are dominated by cone-bearing trees and are found in cold, mountainous, or high-latitude regions.
  • Mediterranean forests occur between 30°–40° latitudes on western coasts and have dry summers and wet winters.

question:
Which type of biome is located in Eastern North America, Western Europe, and Northeast Asia?

SSC CHSL 31/05/2022(Evening)
solution:
• The Deciduous Forest Biome is found in regions with moderate climates and distinct seasons, including spring, summer, autumn, and winter.
  • This biome is characteristically located in:
    • Eastern North America
    • Western and Central Europe
    • Northeast Asia (e.g., parts of China, Korea, and Japan)
  • Trees in this biome shed their leaves annually in autumn to conserve moisture during cold winters.
  • Common tree species include oak, maple, beech, birch, and elm.
  • Rainfall is moderate to high (750–1500 mm annually), supporting rich biodiversity.

Additional Information:

  • Tropical Rainforest Biomes are found near the equator (Amazon, Congo Basin) with year-round rain.
  • Coniferous Forest Biomes are found in colder regions (like Canada, Russia) and have cone-bearing evergreen trees.
  • Aquatic Biomes include freshwater and marine ecosystems, not land-based forest zones.

question:
Which of the following statements about forests is INCORRECT?

SSC MTS 06/10/2021(Afternoon)
option_1: In a forest, trees form the uppermost layer of vegetation.
option_2: Forests protect the soil from erosion.
option_3: In a forest, shrubs form the lowest layer of vegetation.
option_4: Forests influence climate, water cycle and air quality.
solution:
• In a forest, vegetation is arranged in layers based on height and sunlight availability:
    1. Emergent and tree layer – Tallest trees form the uppermost canopy. ✅
    2. Understory layer – Contains shrubs and smaller trees.
    3. Herb layer – Composed of herbs, grasses, and ferns.
    4. Forest floor – Lowest layer with decomposing leaves, fungi, and microorganisms.
  • Hence, shrubs do not form the lowest layer; herbs and ground vegetation do.

Correct Statement Review:

  • (a) ✅Correct – Trees indeed form the uppermost vegetation layer in forests.
  • (b) ✅Correct – Forests help prevent soil erosion by binding the soil with roots.
  • (d) ✅Correct – Forests significantly influence climate, purify air, and help regulate the water cycle.
  • (c) ❌Incorrect – Shrubs are not the lowest layer; herbs and ground-level plants are.

Additional Information:

  • Forest layering helps in diversifying species and ensures efficient resource use like sunlight and moisture.
  • These structural layers create different habitats for various animals and plants.

question:
Coringa is a beautiful _____ forest where the Godavari joins the backwaters of Bay of Bengal.

SSC CHSL 12/8/2021(Morning)
solution:
• Coringa is a well-known mangrove forest located in the East Godavari district of Andhra Pradesh, near where the Godavari River meets the Bay of Bengal.
  • Mangrove forests grow in coastal intertidal zones, where saltwater and freshwater mix.
  • These forests are adapted to saline, swampy soils and have aerial roots (pneumatophores) to absorb oxygen.
  • Coringa is India's second largest stretch of mangrove forests after the Sundarbans and is known for rich biodiversity, including endangered species like olive ridley turtles.

Additional Information:

  • Evergreen forests remain green year-round and are found in areas of high rainfall.
  • Coniferous forests are typical of cold climates and higher altitudes.
  • Deciduous forests shed their leaves seasonally and are found in monsoon climates.

question:
Which of the following trees will you find in the Littoral forests?

SSC CHSL 19/10/2020(Afternoon)
solution:
• Littoral forests, also known as mangrove forests, are found in coastal and tidal zones, especially in deltas and estuaries where freshwater and seawater mix.
  • The Sundari tree (Heritiera fomes) is the most prominent species in the Sundarbans mangrove forest, located in the Ganga-Brahmaputra delta (India and Bangladesh).
  • These trees are specially adapted to saline, waterlogged soils, with aerial roots for respiration in oxygen-poor conditions.
  • Sundari gives the Sundarbans its name and is a defining species of littoral vegetation.

Additional Information:

  • Chinar is found in temperate regions like Kashmir; it is not a coastal species.
  • Ebony is a hardwood tree found in tropical evergreen forests, not specifically in littoral zones.
  • Cypress grows in temperate swampy areas, especially in North America, but is not native to Indian littoral forests.
